""""Just ignorant stupid liberals won't hear* any of it."""" That's better. Your dismissal of Hillary still doesn't address the fact that Trump is continuing to surround himself with the elite and wealthy. The same persons who use loopholes to avoid contributing taxes to our government, who happily send jobs overseas to improve their bottom line but not the life of citizens in the U.S.. How is Trump going to help make our country better when the people he's working with are practiced at only making the lives of their fellow elite members better first? Trickle down economics doesnt work.

And yet no one cares. They've been playing this song since the Bush admin. Step one: place quote by anonymous source in paper of record (ie Wall St Journal). Step two: quote said paper of record (the Wall St Journal said today...) but leave out the context, turning anon source into quotable fact. Step three: repeat quickly and often. Step four: marginalize and ignore your critics. Your move, Media Matters.

If anything, evolution is evidence of a divine order. There really isn't any other way for it to have worked. Random chance is too random to have worked so well so quickly. People that truly understand science are some of the most certain of us that there is a God, a creator, an artificer. If the beauty of creating a world like ours over billions of years isn't more powerful to you than doing it in seven days, you need to reevaluate your perspective.

This is where Liberalism, and the subsequent desire for a nanny state, fails. It is not the government's job to babysit us. We have our own liberty in this nation, at least for now, and we are to exercise it. It is indeed unfortunate that mental illness played a factor here, but unless someone reaches out for help, or a family member were to commit her for evaluation, there is not really much the city could (or should) do.
